abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Technical Assistance Project for Public
            and Private Provision of Infrastructure (TAP4I) in
            Indonesia. The basic objectives were to assist Government of
            Indonesia (GOI) in the implementation of its framework for
            infrastructure development by initiating immediate actions
            to (a) assess priorities in current infrastructure plans for
            reducing infrastructure bottlenecks; and (b) (i) augment and
            enhance program evaluation capability (including, in
            particular, in cross-sectoral linkages and environment
            aspects) within National Development Planning Agency
            (BAPPENAS), and (ii) project preparation capability in line
            agencies responsible for key infrastructure sectors,
            including projects financed by or jointly with the private
            sector. Bank performance was satisfactory. Borrower's
            overall performance during implementation can be assessed as
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were: (i) the project
            has demonstrated that GOI's ability to manage Technical
            Assistance (TA) resources efficiently; (ii) the major policy
            studies undertaken in the power and transport sectors
            demonstrate this capacity clearly, though this was not free
            of pain at the time for the sector managers responsible;
            (iii) in particular, the power sector study was an example
            of best practice achieved and to aim for in future similar
            efforts; and (iv) the implementation experience of TAP4I has
            also some specific cautionary lessons for future projects.
